comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Most likely Muriel G. Sanders Draper, wife of the American tenor Paul Draper. She brought suit for divorce in March 1916, see article in The evening world., March 24, 1916, Final Edition-Extra, Page 10, Col. 5, "C. A. DANA'S GRANDSON IS SUED FOR DIVORCE".

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I agree. Here is her wikipedia entry, which is regrettably brief: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muriel_Draper There is more information in The Encyclopedia of the Harlem Renaissance: books.google.com/books?id=0L0ULjto_OEC&pg=PT756&d... Probably taken in connection with the suffrage opera "Melinda and her Sisters", in which she appeared. This appears to be taken in the same spot as this photo: See also notes under this photo of the cast:

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks to all of you for your great research and pulling the pieces together of the production. I wonder what it was like and how it was received. We'll add some of the information to the records still missing the details.
